snippet: After a primary battle that tugged Mitt Romney to the right, the presumptive Republican nominee is adopting tried and tested techniques to “look more centrist” in the main race.
abstract: Political Memo; presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney, after a primary battle that tugged him toward the right, is adopting tried and tested techniques to 'look more centrist' in the main presidential race; his ability to resist attempts by Pres Obama's campaign to brand him as 'extreme' could determine the election's outcome in November.
lead_paragraph: After a primary battle that tugged Mitt Romney to the right, the presumptive Republican nominee is adopting tried and tested techniques to “look more centrist” in the main race.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney’s Need to Move Past Divisive Primary
headline.main: After Divisive Primary, Shifting to the Center
headline.print_headline: After Divisive Primary, Shifting to the Center
